docs.lead_paragraph: The first sports work stoppage of the social networking era has left N.F.L. players concerned, confused and a little distracted. But they were chatty and -- at least temporarily -- united. Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers sounded a one-word rallying cry on Twitter just minutes after union decertification became official: ''Unity.'' Moments later, Rodgers acknowledged that there were more important things happening in the world than a football labor dispute. ''Lots of stuff in the news today, but let's remember the people in Japan and keep them in our thoughts and prayers.''

headline.main: Players Have Plenty to Say, In Short Bursts

docs.abstract: The Fifth Down column on flurry of Twitter posts by NFL players in response to league's work stoppage. Photos (M)0
